body:
The statement `zap.xml_report` should be called before shutting down ZAP, otherwise it might not complete successfully.
You also need to do something with the returned report (e.g. print, save to file).

As per your suggestion I genrated the report before shutdown #using owasp gem require 'owasp_zap' include OwaspZap zap = Zap.new :base=>'http://127.0.0.1:8084', :target=>'http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com', :zap=>'/root/ZAP/ZAP_2.4.1/zap.sh', :output=>'logfile.txt' zap.start :daemon=>true p 'Starting ZAP' # Wait for ZAP to start until zap.running? sleep(2) end #To set format of the alerts zap.alerts.view p 'Generate some requests for Active Scan' spider = zap.spider spider.start sleep(2) # Wait for the spider to finish while spider.running? sleep(2) end p 'Starting Active Scan...' scan = zap.ascan # Obtaining the Attack from zap instance scan.start sleep(2) # Wait for the active scan to finish while scan.running? sleep(2) end # do something with results p 'Generating Alerts' alert = zap.alerts alert.view sleep(2) content = zap.xml_report file = File.open("report.xml", 'w') file.write(content) zap.shutdown exit Now when i do "cat report.xml" the output doesnt seem to be right root@something:~# cat report.xml ``` html ZAP API UI

ZAP API UI

Component: core

Other: xmlreport

Generates a report in XML format
```

Yeah, doesn't look right.
Do you see the report when accessing the following URL while ZAP is running?
http://127.0.0.1:8084/OTHER/core/other/xmlreport/

I did a curl of the url 
root@vdeck:~# curl 127.0.0.1:8084/OTHER/core/other/xmlreport

``` html
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><OWASPZAPReport generated="Mon, 17 Aug 2015 12:38:00" version="2.4.1">
<site host="www.testa2jul15.domain.com" name="http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com" port="80" ssl="false"><alerts/></site></OWASPZAPReport>
```

OK, that's the expected content.
Are you sure that you used `cat` on the correct `report.xml` file?
That HTML form is only shown when accessing:
http://127.0.0.1:8084/UI/core/other/xmlreport/
(which ZAP gem doesn't, at least when calling `xml_report`)

I put a print statement to print the contents in the script only ``` #using owasp gem require 'owasp_zap' include OwaspZap zap = Zap.new :base=>'http://127.0.0.1:8084', :target=>'http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com', :zap=>'/root/ZAP/ZAP_2.4.1/zap.sh', :output=>'logfile.txt' zap.start :daemon=>true p 'Starting ZAP' # Wait for ZAP to start until zap.running? sleep(2) end p 'Generate some requests for Active Scan' spider = zap.spider spider.start sleep(2) # Wait for the spider to finish while spider.running? sleep(2) end p 'Starting Active Scan...' scan = zap.ascan # Obtaining the Attack from zap instance scan.start sleep(2) # Wait for the active scan to finish while scan.running? sleep(2) end #To set format of the alerts alert = zap.alerts.view # do something with result content = zap.xml_report p content.to_s file = File.open("report1.xml", 'w') file.write(content) sleep(2) zap.shutdown exit ``` The output is as follows root@vdeck:~# ruby owasp_run.rb "Starting ZAP" "Generate some requests for Active Scan" "Starting Active Scan..." ``` \n "\nZAP API UI\n\n\n\n

ZAP API UI

\n

Component: core

\n

Other: xmlreport

\nGenerates a report in XML format
\n\n
\n
\n\n" ```

OK, append the following line to file `log4j.properties` (located in same directory as `zap.log` file):
`log4j.logger.org.zaproxy.zap.extension.api.API = DEBUG`

Run the ruby script.
Provide the last lines of `zap.log` file. Specially the ones that have:
`DEBUG org.zaproxy.zap.extension.api.API  - handleApiRequest`

Below is the zap.log file output ``` 2015-08-17 14:58:14,194 [ZAP-ProxyThread-16] DEBUG API - handleApiRequest http://127.0.0.1:8084/JSON/ascan/view/status/?zapapiformat=JSON 2015-08-17 14:58:14,194 [ZAP-ProxyThread-16] DEBUG API - handleApiRequest returning: {"status":"100"} 2015-08-17 14:58:14,200 [ZAP-ProxyThread-17] DEBUG API - handleApiRequest http://127.0.0.1:8084/JSON/core/view/alerts/?baseurl=http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com&zapapiformat=JSON 2015-08-17 14:58:14,241 [ZAP-ProxyThread-17] DEBUG API - handleApiRequest returning: {"alerts":[{"other":"","param":"PHPSESSID","alert":"Cookie set without HttpOnly flag","evidence":"PHPSESSID=log68f8mtd6jbr1vd8lhs6sgu1; path=/","confidence":"Medium","solution":"Ensure that the HttpOnly flag is set for all cookies.","url":"http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com","reference":"www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly","id":"0","risk":"Low","description":"A cookie has been set without the HttpOnly flag, which means that the cookie can be accessed by JavaScript. ZAP API UI

Component: core

Other: xmlreport

Generates a report in XML format
2015-08-17 14:58:16,297 [ZAP-ProxyThread-19] DEBUG API - handleApiRequest http://127.0.0.1:8084/JSON/core/action/shutdown/ 2015-08-17 14:58:16,298 [ZAP-ProxyThread-19] DEBUG API - handleApiRequest returning: {"Result":"OK"} ```
Is it something to do with the xml_report function called?

Also, I ran zap.sh through command line, and I see the xml report generated doesn't contain much information. 

root@vdeck:~/ZAP/ZAP_2.4.1# ./zap.sh -port 8082 -daemon -config api.disablekey=true -quickurl http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com -quickout /root/alerts_manual.xml

root@vdeck:~# cat alerts_manual.xml 

```
<?xml version="1.0"?><OWASPZAPReport version="2.4.1" generated="Mon, 17 Aug 2015 15:33:52">
<site name="http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com" host="www.testa2jul15.domain.com" port="80" ssl="false"><alerts></alerts></site></OWASPZAPReport>root@vdeck:~#
```

Yes, it seems so. Not sure why it's being called:
http://127.0.0.1:8084/UI/core/other/xmlreport/
instead of:
http://127.0.0.1:8084/OTHER/core/other/xmlreport/

Are you using latest version of ruby client? Is this one https://github.com/vpereira/owasp_zap?
Looking at the [source](https://github.com/vpereira/owasp_zap/blob/master/lib/owasp_zap.rb#L110) it calls the correct API.

Regarding the XML report being (almost) empty, most likely it didn't run the active scan or no alerts were raised (need to look at the log to see what's the problem).

Now it  is going to URL you have mentioned

```

```
require 'owasp_zap'
include OwaspZap


zap = Zap.new :base=>'http://127.0.0.1:8084', :target=>'http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com', :zap=>'/root/ZAP/ZAP_2.4.1/zap.sh', :output=>'logfile.txt'
zap.start :daemon=>true

p 'Starting ZAP'
# Wait for ZAP to start
until zap.running?
    sleep(2)
end

p 'Generate some requests for Active Scan'
spider = zap.spider
spider.start
sleep(2)

# Wait for the spider to finish
while spider.running?
    sleep(2)
end

p 'Starting Active Scan...'
scan = zap.ascan # Obtaining the Attack from zap instance
scan.start
sleep(2)

# Wait for the active scan to finish
while scan.running?
    sleep(2)
end


#To set format of the alerts
alerts = JSON.parse(zap.alerts.view)['alerts']
alerts.sort_by! {|item| item['risk']}
p alerts
```

ALLOW-FROM allows specific websites to frame the web page in supported web browsers).", "url"=>"http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com/robots.txt", "reference"=>"http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ieinternals/archive/2010/03/30/combating-clickjacking-with-x-frame-options.aspx", "id"=>"9", "risk"=>"Medium", "description"=>"X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.", "attack"=>"", "messageId"=>"6", "cweid"=>"0", "wascid"=>"0"}, {"other"=>"", "param"=>"", "alert"=>"X-Frame-Options Header Not Set", "evidence"=>"", "confidence"=>"Medium", "solution"=>"Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY.  ALLOW-FROM allows specific websites to frame the web page in supported web browsers).", "url"=>"http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com", "reference"=>"http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ieinternals/archive/2010/03/30/combating-clickjacking-with-x-frame-options.aspx", "id"=>"4", "risk"=>"Medium", "description"=>"X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.", "attack"=>"", "messageId"=>"4", "cweid"=>"0", "wascid"=>"0"}, {"other"=>"", "param"=>"", "alert"=>"X-Frame-Options Header Not Set", "evidence"=>"", "confidence"=>"Medium", "solution"=>"Most modern Web browsers support the X-Frame-Options HTTP header. Ensure it's set on all web pages returned by your site (if you expect the page to be framed only by pages on your server (e.g. it's part of a FRAMESET) then you'll want to use SAMEORIGIN, otherwise if you never expect the page to be framed, you should use DENY.  ALLOW-FROM allows specific websites to frame the web page in supported web browsers).", "url"=>"http://www.testa2jul15.domain.com/sitemap.xml", "reference"=>"http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ieinternals/archive/2010/03/30/combating-clickjacking-with-x-frame-options.aspx", "id"=>"14", "risk"=>"Medium", "description"=>"X-Frame-Options header is not included in the HTTP response to protect against 'ClickJacking' attacks.", "attack"=>"", "messageId"=>"7", "cweid"=>"0", "wascid"=>"0"}]

```
The report is empty because of a bug (it only happens in daemon mode, still in git bisect).

rename.from: Running zap through a ruby script and I dont see any xml report generated
rename.to: Report not generated in daemon mode

body: Does this also affect the HTML report? With 2.4.1 I'm seeing a blank report, but it was working previously.
Yes, both types. This issue "just" affects 2.4.1.

issue.title: Jenkins + ZAProxy Report not generated in daemon mode

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
I read that this is a bug, is it isolated to 2.4.1 or is there a stable build that does not have this issue?

Cheers.

issue.title: Scaning https site doesn't work

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Hello!

I'm using zap docker image owasp/zap2docker-stable to execute scans. I'm running it with command:

```
zap.sh -daemon -port 8090 -host 0.0.0.0 -config api.key=12345
```

It works good for http targets, but when I'm trying to execute scan under https - it doesn't finish.

Last thing which I can see in docker container log is:

```
29639 [ZAP-ProxyThread-16] WARN org.zaproxy.zap.extension.api.API  - handleApiRequest error: {"code":"bad_api_key","message":"Invalid or missing API key"}
Invalid or missing API key (bad_api_key)
    at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.api.API.handleApiRequest(API.java:282)
    at org.parosproxy.paros.core.proxy.ProxyThread.processHttp(ProxyThread.java:321)
    at org.parosproxy.paros.core.proxy.ProxyThread.run(ProxyThread.java:236)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
```

Could you help me with this issue?

Thanks!

issue.title: Reports not being generated by ZAProxy Plugin in jenkins

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Hello 

I created a new job and used ZAProxy plugin in jenkins. The plugin properly worked and it was scanning the site and took around 3 hours for complete scan. The console output showed 

Status scan = 85%
Alerts number =         ApiResponseElement numberOfAlerts = 819

Messages number =       ApiResponseElement numberOfMessages = 13999

But the report generted was empty.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6698132/9753886/4573793c-56e0-11e5-9d9b-5ddbe46bf727.png)

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
